    • Uses of ApiResponse in com.mobilab.accountservice.controller

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ApiResponse AccountController.create(@Valid Account account, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Creates New account and returns transaction id and transaction path url to see the results
      ApiResponse AccountController.findAll()
      Returns all created accounts
      ApiResponse TransactionController.findOne(java.lang.Long id)
      Get transaction result of create update and financial transactions
      ApiResponse AccountController.findOne(java.lang.String id)
      Returns account information for an existing account number
      ApiResponse TransactionController.getLogs(LogRequest logRequest, java.lang.String accountNo)
      Reprieves all transaction logs for specific account
      ApiResponse AccountController.handleTransaction(ActionTransaction action, java.lang.String accountNo, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Handles financial transactions include deposit, withdrawal and transfer

      private ApiResponse MethodArgumentNotValidExceptionHandler.processFieldErrors(java.util.List<org.springframework.validation.FieldError> fieldErrors) 
      ApiResponse AccountController.updateAccount(Account account, java.lang.String accountNo, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Updates existing account and returns transaction id and transaction path url to see the results

      service method that fetches transaction logs from data base ( both financial and non-financial logs)
      ApiResponse TransactionResultService.getResponseForTID(long tid)
      Service method used for retrieving transaction result It first looks at response gateway cache and if there is no response there, then it will connect to the db and read logs for that transaction id
